DOC.brief_summary: This study uses a meal-challenge protocol to assess if patients with anorexia nervosa show a differential meal-induced metabolism and response compared to healthy controls, and determines how genetic variation influence this difference.
DOC.brief_title: Study of Food Aversion in Patients With Anorexia Nervosa
DOC.detailed_description: Anorexia nervosa is a brain-based disorder that often leads to serious health consequences including death. The EPHX2 gene has been identified as a susceptibility gene for anorexia nervosa. With the application of complementary research approaches, this study aims to develop a multi-omics biomarker system for anorexia nervosa through a food-challenge protocol. The data will allow us to understand how disease susceptibility gene(s) contribute to food aversion, psychopathology, and outcome in patients with anorexia nervosa.
DOC.criteria: Ill AN subjects will meet current Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM V) diagnosis of restrictingtype AN, body mass index (BMI) between11 kg/m2 and 17.5 kg/m2 . Recovered AN must meet the following criteria at time of study entry: 1) Past DSM V diagnosis of AN; 2) BMI between 18.5 kg/m2 and 30 kg/m2; 3) Having maintained a BMI of >18.5 for at least one year. Control must be healthy adolescent or woman negative on our screen for AN, other Axis I psychiatric illnesses, and having maintained a BMI of between18.530 since the age of 18. Exclusion criteria for AN and control subjects includes: Organic brain syndrome, schizophrenia and schizoaffective disorder, untreated thyroid disease, renal disease, hepatic disease, and the use of fishoil containing supplements within the last three months of the study. All pregnant and lactating individuals will be excluded.
